name: NPR
text:
A 37-year-old English translator is running against Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko after her husband was denied registration as a candidate and jailed.

"I'm tired of being silent. I'm tired of being afraid," she said at a giant rally Thursday.
https://t.co/0wTocmTwQ5

name: NPR
text: RT @Lucian_Kim: "I don't need power, but my husband is behind bars. I've had to hide my children. I'm tired of putting up with it. I'm tired of being silent. I'm tired of being afraid." https://t.co/vQJYrbcne5

name: NPR
text:
One analysis found that over the lifetime of affected people, childhood lead exposure could result in a loss of nearly $1 trillion in earnings in lower and middle-income countries in Africa, Asia, Latin America and the Caribbean.
https://t.co/CNzlOP8zWD

name: NPR
text:
The Army is now getting back to large-scale training during the pandemic — with some 4,000 National Guard soldiers recently arriving at Fort Irwin, Calif.

Generals say the troops are regularly monitored for symptoms.
https://t.co/hC0xJ6Yva5

name: NPR
text:
Lockdowns have made it difficult to sell goats in India for Eid. 

But goat dealers are finding creative ways to drum up sales — trying everything from a goat beauty pageant hosted by a TikTok star to WhatsApp orders.
https://t.co/HcE2Uv6ogL
